intro: Brachyscome latisquamea, commonly known as the narrow-scale everlasting daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white and pink. The plant features narrow, scale-like leaves that give it its common name, and it is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Brachyscome latisquamea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its long-lasting blooms and drought tolerance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
